font.marquee: ** All Southeast Valley Schools will be closed the remainder of the year, per the Governor's announcement on April 17, 2020. Voluntary Continuous Learning Opportunities will continue until May 21st. More information to come next week. **

li.a: Watch this space for important notifications.

form.style: background-color: Black; color: White; font-size: 14px; text-align: center; padding: 0 15px; margin: 0 5px;

fieldset.p: Southeast Valley Schools (SW-G & PV) is now using GRANICUS formerly GovDelivery, to send out important notifications to parents and students . You may choose to receive notifications via email or text message.
fieldset.div: To sign up for notifications or to access your subscriber preferences, please enter your contact information below.

h3.a: Welcome to Southeast Valley - School Notification Systems Available

div.p:
School notification systems available:
For Parents and Guardians, in the JMC Student Database - In addition to your email address, if you would like to receive text notifications regarding school building related messages for your student, within your parent contact information you can enter your cell phone number with your cell phone carrier's suffix at the end of your phone number in the email address area. . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Press Release-Help Fuel the Future Promotion

div.p:
Print Version
It has been one month ago today as I type this that I last had contact with the 40 members of this year’s Southeast Valley’s boys’ track team. As coaches we left practice that day extremely excited as to what the future of the upcoming season looked like as we had just finished our 4th week of practice. When we left that night, we knew Governor Reynolds had announced that schools would remain open, but two days later on Sunday evening that changed.
I’ve thought about writing this article several times in the past four weeks, but first I thought we might start again on April 15th so I would just wait until then. Then came the announcement last week that it would be April 30th. Currently, there is slim hope that we might get to start on May 1st and be able to have a shortened track and field season yet thanks to the IAHSAA and IGHSAU for coming up with a plan. As I watch other states and Des Moines cancel their spring sports seasons, I’ve decided it is time to acknowledge the hard work this year’s team put in for a month and possibly dream about what could have been, in case we . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about 2020 Boys Track Article

p.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

div.style: background-color: White; color: Black; font-size: 12px; text-align: left; padding: 0 15px; margin: 0 5px;

div.div:
ANNUAL NOTIFICATION - NOTIFICATION OF NON-DISCRIMINATION POLICY STATEMENT: Southeast Valley School offers career and technical programs in the following areas of study: Agriculture, Business, Family consumer Science, Health Science, Industrial Technology.
It is the policy of the Prairie Valley Community School District and Southeast Webster Grand Community School District not to illegally discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, religion, creed, age (for employment), marital status (for programs), sexual orientation, gender identity and socioeconomic status (for programs) in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. If you have questions or a grievance related to this policy please contact the district’s Equity Coordinator, Lisa Willardson, Equity Coordinator, 1005 Riddle Street, 515-352-5575, lwillardson@svjags.org or to Greg Slininger, Principal: Southeast Webster-Grand CSD, 30850 Paragon Ave., Burnside, IA 50521, 515-359-2235.
